alert.note: Alert for Anderson (Kansas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Severe Weather Statement issued July 05 at 12:56AM CDT until July 05 at 1:30AM CDT by NWS Topeka
info.description: ...A SEVERE THUNDERSTORM WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 130 AM CDT FOR SOUTHERN FRANKLIN...ANDERSON AND COFFEY COUNTIES... At 1255 AM CDT, severe thunderstorms were located along a line extending from 6 miles northwest of Mound City to 3 miles south of Lone Elm to 4 miles northeast of Yates Center, moving southeast at 55 mph. HAZARD...60 mph wind gusts and penny size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Expect damage to roofs, siding, and trees. Locations impacted include... Garnett, Burlington, Waverly, Richmond, Colony, New Strawn, Gridley, Greeley, Lane, Westphalia, Kincaid, Lone Elm, Beto Junction, Harris, John Redmond Reservoir and Le Roy. This includes Interstate 35 between mile markers 152 and 155. HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...0.75 IN WIND THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX WIND GUST...60 MPH
info.instruction: For your protection move to an interior room on the lowest floor of a building. Torrential rainfall is occurring with these storms, and may lead to flash flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.
